NEWS BITES

U.K. Rents Rose 4.5% in Second Quarter of 2019 Average U.K. rents grew by 4.5% in the second quarter, year over year to £774 (US$954) monthly, according to an index from the real estate company Belvoir. Tenant applications have also experienced a marked increase, growing 32% in July. Demand for rental homes appears greater than that for apartments, with 56% of Belvoir locations seeing a rise in apartment rents and 66% seeing the same for houses. PropertyWire

Rachel Weisz and Daniel Craig Break Even on New York City Sale Rachel Weisz and Daniel Craig have sold an apartment in Manhattan’s East Village for $6 million, breaking even on the deal. The couple paid close to $1 million over asking price for the three-bedroom in 2012, when it was priced at $4.99 million. The full-floor unit has three balconies. Last year they purchased a Brooklyn townhouse for $6.75 million from writer Martin Amis. New York Post

80% of Americans Say Housing Affordability Is At Crisis Level Eighty percent of Americans believe the nation is experiencing a crisis of housing affordability, according to a study done on behalf of the National Association of Home Builders. And 78% believe the issue is present in their state. That marks a significant increase from last November, when 73% said they believed there was an issue nationwide and 68% said it was affecting their state. World Property Journal

Developer Marks Down Flats As Hong Kong Prices Fall As Hong Kong home prices continue to fall amid political unrest, the area’s largest developer is reducing the prices of a new slate of flats by 25%. Units at Sun Hung Kai Properties’ new project, located near Sham Shui Po, an area that’s seen protest activity, will cost about HK $21,722 (US$2,770). Developer CK Asset has revised its payment plans and loan agreements in order to sell out their available flats. Prices for existing homes across Hong Kong fell 0.7% from May to July. South China Morning Post

Dubai Summer Sales Marked Four-Year High Sales of new Dubai homes hit a four-year high during the typically busy period between June and August. Sales grew 33.46% on the year prior. The value of sales also increased, rising by 14.94% after a recent price dip. Existing home sales increased by 20.43%, though the value dipped slightly. Dubai Expo 2020, which will bring many to the city, begins in October 2020. Khaleej Times
